intro: Tetratheca decora, commonly known as the silver wattle, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its silvery, finely hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, woody pods. Tetratheca decora is often found in coastal and heathland environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is an ornamental plant appreciated for its attractive foliage and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
